intro: Navarretia leptalea, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Navarretia leptalea is known for its rapid life cycle, completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season.
